title: Provides for a minimum 15 day grace period before a late fee may be charged a credit card holder unless there is local, on-line or telephone access available
summary: Provides a fifteen day grace period for the imposition of late fees for credit card bills.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3004

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 21, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. PERRY -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. CAHILL,
         COLTON, COOK, HEASTIE, HOOPER, MENG, TOWNS -- read once  and  referred
         to the Committee on Higher Education

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the general business law, in relation to providing a
         grace period for the imposition of late fees for credit card bills

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The general business law is amended by adding a new section
    2  518-b to read as follows:
    3    S  518-B.  CREDIT CARD ACCOUNT LATE FEES; FIFTEEN DAY GRACE PERIOD. NO
    4  ISSUER OF A CREDIT CARD DOING BUSINESS IN THIS STATE SHALL CHARGE A LATE
    5  FEE TO THE CREDIT CARD ACCOUNT OF ANY PERSON WHO FAILS TO TIMELY MAKE  A
    6  PAYMENT ON SUCH CREDIT CARD ACCOUNT, UNTIL AT LEAST FIFTEEN DAYS FOLLOW-
    7  ING THE DATE THAT SUCH PAYMENT WAS DUE.
    8    S  2.  This  act shall take effect on the thirtieth day after it shall
    9  have become a law.






        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD02561-01-1
